data.title: Option to stick output to bottom
data.body:
When you have a lot of text scrolling by in the Output window (for example grunt tasks), it would be a nice feature to be able to let the Output window stick to the bottom, so you always see the last lines of text.

I saw an issue #3351 but this issue doesn't make it clear to me if there is an option for this or not.

data.title: How to edit Comment Line style
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7
- OS Version: Windows 7

Hi, i used `Ctrl + /` to comment code like: `//`
but i want to output like this: `/* $1 */` :smiley_cat: 
How can i do it?

data.title: Find in files issue
data.body:
the behaviour of CMD + SHIFT + F is different from CMD + F, CMD + F will automatically fill the word under cursor into search input field, but find in files will not.

I have to select word under cursor before CMD + SHIFT + F to perform this action, and in my opinion, it's not convenient to use find in file feature.

data.title: Improvement: Own git tracking for each branch / marking files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Linux Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new branch
2. Save changes
3. Move to another branch.
4. Feel frustration, since all changes from previous branch still in the Git section.

It would be **awesome**, if there will be own git tracking for every branch, because now, if you change something in several branches, staging changes after that turning into a nightmare. At least, marking like "branch -> filename" would make life easier.

Thanks in advance!

data.title: themes.dark+: Highlight keyword operators
data.body: This PR makes operators scoped as `keyword.operator` be highlighted with the same style as `keyword.control`. Before: After: See also https://github.com/MagicStack/MagicPython/issues/69. The issue was originally reported to MagicPython, but I believe that this PR will solve many similar problems for other language highlighters, since `keyword.operator` is the standard scope for operators in ST, Atom and TextMate.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a git project
2. display the terminal
3. input `git log`, then showing some latest commits of the project, if you hit 'enter', it show some more to you. if you wanna go back, you'll hit `ctrl + c` or `q`
4. **the issue**: when I go back  to the input surface, if I input something, it display some git logs to me wiredly, and I can't go on my work.

data.title: Expose IBackupFileService interfaces to get lists of backed up files
Special keys don't work as shortcuts in dvorak layout
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:01:10.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.3|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|1.0.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set keyboard to Dvorak layout. In this layout the key marked "{" is now the "/" which is used for commenting.
2. Try to comment with the key marked "{" on the layout. It instead indents left as should be done on a US layout. 
3. Changing it does not work because in the editor pressing the pressing the key marked "{" produces "/" as it should according to the dvorak layout. 


To clarify: The dvorak keyboard layout works correctly in the editor. But not when using shortcuts. And the shortcuts cannot be re-mapped because its tied to the editor.

data.title: Avoid reloading Html Preview window when changing tabs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: OS X

The contents displayed in the HTML preview tab window gets reloaded when tabbing off and back to the preview tab window.

Is there a way this can be avoided. 
I'm using the HTML preview window to display custom content in two separate extensions:   
- [Python](https://github.com/DonJayamanne/pythonVSCode)  
    + Displaying results from Jupyter kernel
- [Git History](https://github.com/DonJayamanne/gitHistoryVSCode/issues/51)  
    + Displaying Git log 

As you can imagine this doesn't produce the best UX (https://github.com/DonJayamanne/gitHistoryVSCode/issues/51).

data.title: Use enum for markdown.previewFrontMatter setting
data.body: Closes #16185

data.title: Fix #15765. Update textarea state even if there is no selection change in composition
data.body:
This PR aims to fix #15765, #16017, #16133. Previously we would update textArea's state (including value) when there is any selection change. This means, if the selection changes in composition, the textArea state is updated in time. However for those composition that don't trigger any selection change, the textArea is out of date, which leads to some words/characters duplication.

As listed issues are talking about Japanese or Accents, here I'd like to describe the behavior with another IME.

1. Switch to Chinese IME
2. Type `a` and the first selection change kicks in, we update the textArea state accordingly.
    ![screen shot 2016-11-28 at 3 01 15 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/20689703/9d5dddb8-b57b-11e6-821f-6b6446756f87.png)
3. Press `space` to choose the first word ``. There is no selection change, we forget to update the textArea state. 
![screen shot 2016-11-28 at 3 03 03 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/20689847/2cbc453a-b57c-11e6-9982-3eee2df335ab.png)

4. Since the textArea state is not cleaned, so next time when you press any key, let's say `enter`, the text being inserted into the editor is `\n`. ![ime](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/20689889/5b33db1c-b57c-11e6-9895-df1abfc3c98a.gif)

From the code level, previously we were updating the textArea state for IE and Edge as the textarea is not cleared initially on those two browsers. Now we do the same thing for all compositionEnd operations as if there is no selection change in composition, the textArea is not cleared as well.

data.title: Extract Json Extension package.json Strings for Localization
data.body: Closes #16180

data.title: Use enum for Markdown.previewFrontMatter setting
data.body: The `Markdown.previewFrontMatter` setting is an enum and should be listed as such in the markdown extension `package.json`.

data.title: Extract settings strings for Localization in css extension
data.body:
Closes #16179

For reference, here are the regexps used with find replace I used to do this automatically:

Extract the description strings as keys for package.nls.json:

```
"((css|scss|sass|less)[^"]+?)": \{(.|\n)+?"description": "(.+?)"\n\s+\}
```

```
"\1.desc": "\4"
```


Convert package.json settings to use these new keys:

```
("((css|scss|sass|less)[^"]+?)"(.|\n)+?"description": )"(.+?)"
```

```
\1"%\2.desc%"
```

data.title: Extract settings strings in html extension
data.body: Closes #16178

data.title: Powershell write-output does not write to debug console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64-bit Build 14393.447

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select HelloWorld.ps1 containing one line
        Write-output "Hello World"
2. Open Debug view
3. Open Debug Console
4. Click Start Debugging.  Script executes but nothing shows in Debug Console.

This is probably a usage issue since I am just starting with Visual Studio Code.  Thanks in advance for your assistance.

data.title: cast highlighting inconsistent across many themes
Toggle codelens via key bindings command

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'd like a way to toggle codelens via a keyboard shortcut.

It would be very very welcome, sometimes in files where you have a lot of referenceable material packed in a small space (c# properties for instance) it's very distracting and other times it's the only way to get to things (c# debug test for instance).

Being able to toggle codelens would be the bee's knees.

EDIT: Oh and to add to this, being able to toggle codelens is also very nice from a responsiveness perspective as omnisharp really has a tough time serving all those "x references" queries. Seeing huge cpu spikes where mono.osx is at 200% for a while before dropping to normal levels again.
Not a problem if you stay in 1 file but going from file to file you keep hitting the language server with quite some load.
